page.title: 07HODNET'S FIRE STATION
page.content: Many years ago the fire station was in Hearne Lane and was horse drawn with a hand operated pump. Hodnet has a fire station because the "Sentinal" steam lorries used to set fire to the thatched roofs of the black and white buildings. The present fire station is at the end of Station Road (06140283). Practice nights are on Mondays. The fire engine is a Ford made in 1977. The firemen are part time volunteers and are called to the station by personal "bleepers"; up until 1983 a siren at the station called them out. In 1985, plans were made for a new fire station and this is to be built on the side of the old one. Also incorporated will be a tower to practice rescues from buildings. Calls are made for fires,chimney fires, animal rescues and road accidents.
